page.title: 02A History of Rhos
page.content: Rhos means heath or moorland.It is associated with the estate Llanerchrugog hall.So we got the name Rhosllanerchrugog which means heathery glade. This name was used at least 400 years ago.In 1551it belonged to John ap Hugh ap John ap Ieuan ap Deicws. His son was the first to use Hughes as a surname.He owned over 700 acres of the area of Rhos,Johnstown and th surrounding area. There are three main farms in the area_Grango,Bryn Owen,Tan y Clawdd. Coal was the main industry of the local area during the 19th century.John Wilkinson first used coal from the coal mine at Llwyenion.In the late 19th century,there was as many as 50 pits in Rhos,Hafod being the biggest.
